title: [ICE] rustc panics with 'Trying to convert unsized value to lval'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
rustc panics with the following backtrace when building [this fork of rlibc](https://github.com/alexchandel/rlibc). I can't even tell which line of my code is causing it, but it occurs after most of the warnings are printed:

``` sh
...
src/posix/fcntl.rs:6:62: 6:66 warning: unused variable: `mode`, #[warn(unused_variables)] on by default
src/posix/fcntl.rs:6 pub unsafe extern fn open(path: *const char_t, flags: int_t, mode: mode_t) -> int_t {
                                                                                  ^~~~
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Trying to convert unsized value to lval', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/librustc_trans/trans/datum.rs:495

stack backtrace:
```
